actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Judiciary.
Committee on Judiciary. Ordered to be reported with an amendment in the nature of a substitute favorably.
Committee on Judiciary. Reported to Senate by Senator Biden with an amendment in the nature of a substitute. Without written report.
Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 94.
Passed Senate with an amendment by Voice Vote.
Referred to the House Committee on Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Crime and Criminal Justice.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Crime and Criminal Justice

official_title: A bill to amend title 18 of the United States Code, to increase the term of imprisonment for offenses involving driving while intoxicated when a minor is present in the vehicle.
short_title: Drunk Driving Child Protection Act of 1991

summary.text: Drunk Driving Child Protection Act of 1991 - Amends the Assimilative Crimes Statute to require the punishment for operating a motor vehicle under the influence of a drug or alcohol to include, in addition to any term of imprisonment under State law, imprisonment for one year, or if serious bodily injury of a minor is caused, five years, or if death of a minor is caused, ten years, and/or a fine of up to $1,000 if: (1) a minor (other than the offender) was in the motor vehicle during the offense; and (2) applicable State law does not provide for such additional penalties. Requires the same additional Federal penalties for operating a common carrier under the influence of drugs or alcohol if a minor is present. Expresses the sense of the Congress that the courts, in making determinations regarding child custody and visitation rights, should consider the drunk driving history of persons involved.

titles.title: Drunk Driving Child Protection Act of 1990
